title: Play and communication with 2 year + toddlers!
content:
DID YOU KNOW? 

- Children learn to name things, to sort things and to count.

- Children who are learning to talk make many mistakes. Correcting them, however, will discourage talking.

- Stories, songs, and games prepare children to reading and help them improve how they speak.

- Traditional stories, songs, and games help teach children how to behave.

- Children learn to speak correctly by copying – by listening to others who speak correctly.

- Children can learn and understand what is right and wrong.

- Children also copy their older brothers and sisters and other family members as they learn what is right and wrong.

- Children learn better when they are taught how to behave well instead of being scolded for behaving badly.
